li.text: IHUFCB - is a flag and a unit number for saving cell-by-cell flows
NHUF - is the number of hydrogeologic units
NPHUF - is the number of HUF parameters
IWETIT - is the iteration interval for attempting to wet cells
IHDWET - is a flag that determines which equation is used to define the initial head at cells that become wet:
IOHUFHDS - is a flag and unit number for saving computed heads
IOHUFFLWS - is a flag and unit number for saving computed flows
WETFCT - Wetting factor
HGUNAM(NHUF) - Hydrogeologic unit names
LTHUF(NLAY) - is a flag specifying the layer type
LAYWT(NLAY) - is a flag that indicates if wetting is active. Read one value per layer.
IHGUFLG(5,NHUF) - Formats for printing HUF arrays
HGUHANI(NHUF) - horizontal anisotropy for hydrogeologic units
HGUVANI(NHUF) - vertical anisotropy for hydrogeologic units
HUFHK(NHUF) - horizontal hydraulic conductivity for hydrogeologic units for a particular column and row
HUFVK(NHUF:) - vertical hydraulic conductivity for hydrogeologic units for a particular column and row
HUFSS(NHUF) - specific storage for hydrogeologic units for a particular column and row
HUFSY(NHUF) - specific yield for hydrogeologic units for a particular column and row
HUFHANI(NHUF) - horizontal anisotropy for hydrogeologic units for a particular column and row
HUFKDEP(NHUF) - the depth-dependence coefficient used to modify horizontal hydraulic conductivity for a particular column and row
GS(NCOL,NROW) - ground surface
SC2HUF(NCOL,NROW) - the head coefficient for the uppermost active cell. SC2HUF is set but not used in HUF. It is used by the SFR and UZF packages.
VKAH(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Vertical hydraulic conductivity between the middle of the layer and the middle of the layer beneath it.
SC1(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Specific storage for cells.
WETDRY(NCOL,NROW,NWETD) (NWETD = number of convertible layers) - WETDRY is a combination of the wetting threshold and a flag to indicate which neighboring cells can cause a cell to become wet
HK(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Horizontal transmissivity in the X (row) direction. Later, it is sometimes converted to hydraulic conductivity
HKCC(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - Horizontal transmissivity in the Y (column) direction. Later, it is sometimes converted to hydraulic conductivity
HUFTMP(NCOL,NROW,NHUF) - A temporary array used in printing HUF data.
VDHD(NCOL,NROW,NLAY) - the angle between the grid axis and the principal direction of horizontal hydraulic conductivity.
HUFTHK(NCOL,NROW,NHUF,2) - Define the geometry of hydrogeologic units

para.text: HUFTHK(*,*,*,1) - Top elevation of hydrogeologic unit

li.text: VDHT(NCOL,NROW,NLAY,3:) - Hydraulic Conductivity Tensor for LVDA
A9(NCOL,NROW,NLAY,5) - Stiffness-Coefficient Matrix for 9-Point Stencil in LVDA.
GWFHUFDAT(10) - an array of GWFHUFTYPE for multiple grids
GWFHUFTYPE

image.title: Diagram illustrating how the subroutines are connected.

li.text: GWF2HUF7AR - Allocate Array Storage for Hydrogeologic Unit Package
GWF2HUF7AD - Set HOLD to BOTM Whenever a Wettable Cell is Dry
GWF2HUF7FM - Add Leakage Correction and Storage to HCOF and RHS, and Calculate Conductance as Required.
GWF2HUF7BDS - Compute Storage Budget Flow Term for HUF
GWF2HUF7BDADJ - .Compute Flow Between Adjacent Cells in a Subregion of the Grid
GWF2HUF7BDCH - Compute Flow from Constant-Head Cells
GWF2HUF7OT - Print and Record Heads and Flows Interpolated to HGU's
GWF2HUF7DA - Deallocate HUF Data
SGWF2HUF7GEOMRP - Read and Prepare Hydrogeologic-Unit Geometry. Called by GWF2HUF7AR
SGWF2HUF7SP - Substitute and Prepare Data for Hydrogeologic-Unit Flow Package. Called by GWF2HUF7AR, and GWF2HUF7FM
SGWF2HUF7HK - Substitute for HK parameters. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP, and SGWF2HUF7VDHHV
SGWF2HUF7VKA - Substitute for VKA parameters. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP.
SGWF2HUF7VKL - Calculate VK for a given layer. This subroutine is never called.
SGWF2HUF7VSRCH - Search for top and bottom layer the unit applies to. Called by SGWF2HUF7VKA, SGWF2HUF7FLOT, and SGWF2HUF7HDOT
SGWF2HUF7HSRCH - Search for top and bottom layer the unit applies to.

para.text: IFLG = 0, Do not adjust top of unconfined layer to HNEW
IFLG <> 0, Adjust top of unconfined layer to HNEW
Called by SGWF2HUF7SP, SGWF2HUF7VKL, SGWF2HUF7FLOT, and SGWF2HUF7VDHHV

li.text: SGWF2HUF7SC1 - Substitute for SS parameters. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7N - Initialize and Check HUF Data. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7HCND - Calculate Horizontal Conductances. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7VCND - Calculate Vertical Conductances. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7SYTP - Replace SC1 With SY for Topmost Active Cell for Any I,J. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7SC - Calculate SC1. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7HCOND - Compute Horizontal Branch Conductance for One Layer. Called by SGWF2HUF7HCND
SGWF2HUF7WETCHK - Check for Cells That Go Dry/Rewet. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7WET - Convert Dry Cells to Wet. Called by SGWF2HUF7WETCHK
SGWF2HUF7WDMSG - Print Message When Cells Convert Between Wet and Dry. Called by SGWF2HUF7HCOND, SGWF2HUF7WETCHK, and SGWF2HUF7WET

SGWF2HUF7HHARM - Compute Horizontal Branch Conductance Using Harmonic Mean of Block Conductances (Distance Weighted Harmonic Mean of Transmissivity). Cell Thickness is in CC Upon Entry. Called by SGWF2HUF7HCOND
SGWF2HUF7SC2 - Compute contributions to HCOF and RHS for convertible cell

para.text: Enter subroutine when HO and/or HN are below TOP
IFLG = 0, Calculate contributions to HCOF and RHS
IFLG = 1, Calculate contributions to flow within cell
IFLG = 2, Calculate contributions to sensitivity calculations
Subroutine will halt execution if Sy is not defined.
This subroutine is called from lmt7.f as well as from within HUF.
Called by GWF2HUF7AR, GWF2HUF7FM, and GWF2HUF7BDS

li.text: SGWF2HUF7FLOT - Calculate Flows Within a Given Hydrogeologic Unit. Called by GWF2HUF7OT
SGWF2HUF7HDOT - Calculate Heads Within a Given Hydrogeologic Called by GWF2HUF7OT.
SGWF2HUF7CHFLOT - Compute Flow from Constant-Head Cells in HGU's. Called by GWF2HUF7OT

SGWF2HUF7C - Calculate Horizontal Branch Conductances for Single HGU or for Layer Within An HGU. for Units that pinch out, the equivalent thickness in the adjacent unit is used. Called by SGWF2HUF7FLOT, SGWF2HUF7CHFLOT
SGWF2HUF7IND - Index Hydrogeologic Units for a Given Row/Column Location. Called by SGWF2HUF7HDOT
SGWF2HUF7KDEP1RPGD - Read Parameters for KDEP Capability. Called by GWF2HUF7AR
SGWF2HUF7KDEP - Calculate KDEP Multiplier for Interval. Called by SGWF2HUF7HK, SGWF2HUF7VKA, SGWF2HUF7VKL, SGWF2HUF7HDOT, and SGWF2HUF7C
SGWF2HUF7LVDA1RPGD - Read Parameters for LVDA Capability. Called by GWF2HUF7AR
GWF2HUF7VDFM - Calculate stiffness matrix and RHS for LVDA. Called by GWF2HUF7FM
SGWF2HUF7VDHHV - Populate the Hydraulic Conductivity Arrays for LVDA. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7VDHT - Populate the Hydraulic Conductivity Tensor for LVDA. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7VDF9 - Compute Flow Through Cell Faces Using the 9-Point Stencil. This subroutine is also called by lmt7.f. Called by GWF2HUF7BDADJ, and GWF2HUF7BDCH
SGWF2HUF7VDA9F9 - Compute Flow Through Cell Faces Using the Stored 9-Point Stencil. Called by GWF2HUF7VDFM
SGWF2HUF7VDA9 - Compute and Store Stiffness-Coefficient Matrix for 9-Point Stencil. Called by SGWF2HUF7SP
SGWF2HUF7VDHGET - Grab heads and IBOUND for all local cells. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDF9, and SGWF2HUF7VDA9F9
SGWF2HUF7VDA1 - Calculate the A coefficients for Quadrant I. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDF9, and SGWF2HUF7VDA9
SGWF2HUF7VDA2 - Calculate the A coefficients for Quadrant II. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDF9, and SGWF2HUF7VDA9
SGWF2HUF7VDA3 - Calculate the A coefficients for Quadrant III. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDF9, and SGWF2HUF7VDA9
SGWF2HUF7VDA4 - Calculate the A coefficients for Quadrant IV. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDF9, and SGWF2HUF7VDA9
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFD - Calculate the D coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1, SGWF2HUF7VDA2, SGWF2HUF7VDA3, and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAS1 - Calculate the AS1 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA2
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAS2 - Calculate the AS2 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA2
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAS3 - Calculate the AS3 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA2
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAS4 - Calculate the AS4 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA2
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAW1 - Calculate the AW1 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAW2 - Calculate the AW2 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAW3 - Calculate the AW3 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAW4 - Calculate the AW4 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA1 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAE1 - Calculate the AE1 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA2 and SGWF2HUF7VDA3
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAE2 - Calculate the AE2 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA2 and SGWF2HUF7VDA3
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAE3 - Calculate the AE3 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA2 and SGWF2HUF7VDA3
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAE4 - Calculate the AE4 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA2 and SGWF2HUF7VDA3
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAN1 - Calculate the AN1 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA3 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAN2 - Calculate the AN2 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA3 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAN3 - Calculate the AN3 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA3 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4
SGWF2HUF7VDCOFAN4 - Calculate the AN4 coefficient. Called by SGWF2HUF7VDA3 and SGWF2HUF7VDA4

SGWF2HUF7PNT - Point to HUF Data for a Specific Grid. This subroutine is also called from lmt7.f as well as from within HUF. Called by GWF2HUF7AD, GWF2HUF7FM, GWF2HUF7BDS, GWF2HUF7BDADJ, GWF2HUF7BDCH, and GWF2HUF7OT
GWF2HUF7PSV - Save HUF Data for a Grid. Called by GWF2HUF7AR.
